titleStmt.title: The compleat bone-setter wherein the method of curing broken bones, and strains, and dislocated joynts, together with ruptures, vulgarly called broken bellyes, is fully demonstrated. Whereunto is added The perfect oculist, and The mirrour of health, treating of the pestilence, and all other diseases incident to men, women and children. Also, the acute judgement of urines. / Written originally by Friar Moulton, of the Order of St. Augustine. Now revised, Englished and enlarged by Robert Turner philomathēs.
titleStmt.author: Moulton, Thomas.
Turner, Robert, fl. 1654-1665.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.C. for Martha Harison, at the Lamb at the east-end of Pauls.,

notesStmt.note: "Philomathēs" in Greek characters on title page.
"The perfect oculist", "The mirrour of health", and "Of urines" have caption title; register and pagination are continuous.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Lamb at the east-end of Pauls.
